Hey, uhhh, could Deemos come on this mission? He needs something to do!...
----- Original Message -----
From: "Carnage Dinobot" <carnage@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 19, 2000 7:28 AM
Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars



* Dinobot growled as he watched down the hall, the shadows deep on either
side of the hall. Perfect creeping ground if that was what they were going
to do, but a well place for an ambush as well. But his attention was then
turned to Prowl as he exclaimed the answer that he had known all along,
simply looking at him blankly.
The torture chambers were what he had thought as well, a place where it
would be near to impossible to infiltrate. There the room would be
reinforced and there would only be one entrance, not to mention decent
ventilation but none to the reasonable size for a grown bot to creep
through. It was the perfect area.
Dinobot looks back to the shadows of the hall ahead, noting the doors off to
the side a few more feet ahead. Nodding once as Prowl exclaims that they
should begin there, satisfied that he had actually take not of his concern.
He then growled as he felt small vibrations along the floor in which he
stood, increasing at the rate of movement. Foot steps! Somebot was coming
from.behind. There was no doubt in his mind that if the approaching bot ran
into him or Prowl that they would surely know what was going on, not a good
idea to remain in the center of the call.
Dinobot looked back towards the direction in which Reptilica had disappeared
and simply side stepped to the point where he was ahead of Prowl, his left
shoulder-plate brushing against the wall with no sound. This was all done
just as Prowl had shouted out his warning, a little too late. By the time
the last word was from Prowl's throat Dinobot was leaning with his back
against the wall and his arms crossed, simply looking blankly at the far
wall on the other side of the hall.
Dinobot didn't understand what Prowl had been thinking, perhaps that he was
some sort of novice that didn't know left form right. But if that was what
he thought that he was going to get the shock of his life, a trained and
seasoned warrior leaning against the wall beside him. He knew what he was
doing, knew what to look for and when a bot was approaching from his blind
side. He would not have survived the first Beast Wars if he did not know
what he did.
The only reason for his fate was because he gave into his destiny.while
saving the very fabric of Transformer history as well. As he had said before
he had parished, .there was nothing to regret.
Dinobot then turns his attention towards Scattershot as he comes towards
their position, thinking of how much of a goof he appeared as.talking to a
head on his own head! What a joke!
He shook his head and clenched his jaw, his tail moving at his side with
irritation. *

" These are and fools who miraculously defeat us?!"

* Dinobot snarls into the silencer as he gestures with a claw towards the
approaching Scattershot, absolutely dumbfounded of how they could ever
defeat the Maximals with such fools posing as soldiers.
Glancing at Prowl before looking back down the hall and towards the shadows
with a shake of his head, crossing his arms again and twitching his tail.
How absurd!
But then his attention was the drawn towards retrieving Tavatron again, just
forgetting about how foolish Scattershot seemed to him. Actually feeling
pity for a moment that the Alliance was made of such bots. ( Again, no
offence.just what he thinks)
The thoughts of what horrid devices in which Tavatron might be in store
for.or had already been subjected were out of the question, knowing for a
face that such a torture would quickly be stopped once they reached the
chambers.
Dinobot then clenched his jaw tightly, standing from his lean from the wall.
Indication that it was time to move out again.
But there was a promise that he made to himself just before they had started
out on this rescue mission, the one Alliance bot to even touch with the
intent to harm would be the first one to taste the cold steel of his claws!!
There was doubt about it, if one was to pry into his mind.that he was
beginning to become protective of her. However, he knew that he shouldn't.
It could be an insult to Tavatron herself, being a warrior and all.being
able to take care of herself. But he just.couldn't help it.
Dinobot then looked towards the shadows of the hall, actually finding
comfort in their dark depths.
His thoughts a tangle of what he did and did not know, was and was not sure
of. He was sure that he had to feel SOMETHING in order for him to be so
eager to free Tavatron, but he was not sure what it was or why. But did he
need a reason to feel this way? So many questions.and such simple answers.
If only he could realize them.
But perhaps if he was to ask Tavatron herself one day why he would feel such
a thing, why it was so strong yet not?
It was worth a shot, but when she was up to it.
At the moment Dinobot doubted that she was up to anything, probably half
starved and damaged.
Again the rage built up in the reptile warrior, causing him to snarl deeply
and clench his fist. Yet.without his claw digging into the palm.the sight of
mech fluid out of thin air would give them away.*
